metadata.title: CVE-2019-10142 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's freescale hypervisor managerimplementation, kernel versions 5.0.x up to, excluding 5.0.17. A parameterpassed to an ioctl was incorrectly validated and used in size calculationsfor the page size calculation. An attacker can use this flaw to crash thesystem, corrupt memory, or create other adverse security affects.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
